title: The Forgotten Affairs of Youth
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: There are separate lists for our various forms of accommodation. This is for the Pollock Halls, for example.' She extracted a number  of papers  that had been stapled together.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Instead of heading back to Rankeillor Street, he turned right before Scottish Widows. A trickle of students were coming and going from Pollock Halls. They looked unconcerned about life, joking and laughing.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Blacket Place was a leafy enclave of Georgian mansions hidden between the bustle of Newington Street and the student chaos of Pollock Halls. The Neighbourhood Watch signs were brass plaques, CCTV everywhere, and Billy's ancient Micra was making curtains twitch.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The car seemed to drive itself. Right at the lights, down the slope past Pollock Halls, left at the roundabout, left again.
